content.raw:
Analyzing the situation I believe the cmake system mixed two versions, using one to headers and other to shared libs. I did a ugly hack, moving boost 1.53 (/usr/local) to a temp directory. So the compilation phase was successfully complete. I installed the compiled version of gazebo-1.6.1 in /usr/local but when I try to run, gazebo open and close suddenly. In this way I can conclude that linking errors reported above, was a side effect of cmake system that made confusion with two versions.

But I don't know what is the cause runtime error, I had ros-groovy installed in my machine, I don't know if it is relevant.

Thanks in advance
content.html:
Analyzing the situation I believe the cmake system mixed two versions, using one to headers and other to shared libs. I did a ugly hack, moving boost 1.53 (/usr/local) to a temp directory. So the compilation phase was successfully complete. I installed the compiled version of gazebo-1.6.1 in /usr/local but when I try to run, gazebo open and close suddenly. In this way I can conclude that linking errors reported above, was a side effect of cmake system that made confusion with two versions.

But I don't know what is the cause runtime error, I had ros-groovy installed in my machine, I don't know if it is relevant.

Thanks in advance
